title: Grief
creator: sorcram@gmail.com
content:
<!-- wp:acf/hero-component-secondary {"name":"acf/hero-component-secondary","data":{"title":"Understanding Grief in Divorce","_title":"field_hero_component_secondary_title","subtitle":"\u003cspan\u003eGrieving\u003c/span\u003e \u003cbr\u003e Your Marriage","_subtitle":"field_hero_component_secondary_subtitle","short_description":"","_short_description":"field_hero_component_secondary_short_description","short_descritpion_font_bold":"0","_short_descritpion_font_bold":"field_hero_component_secondary_short_descritpion_font_bold","hero_image":13408,"_hero_image":"field_hero_component_secondary_hero_image","hero_image_mobile":89423,"_hero_image_mobile":"field_hero_component_secondary_hero_image_mobile","select_option":"cta_option","_select_option":"field_hero_component_secondary_select_option","buttons":"","_buttons":"field_hero_component_secondary_buttons","menu":"","_menu":"field_hero_component_secondary_menu","content_wrapper":"small","_content_wrapper":"field_hero_component_secondary_content_wrapper","layout_options":"full-layout","_layout_options":"field_hero_component_secondary_layout_options","content_style":"box-view","_content_style":"field_hero_component_secondary_content_style","content_alignment":"content-middle","_content_alignment":"field_hero_component_secondary_content_alignment","inner_box_content_alignment":"justify-start","_inner_box_content_alignment":"field_hero_component_secondary_inner_box_content_alignment"},"align":"","mode":"preview"} /-->

<!-- wp:acf/intro {"name":"acf/intro","data":{"title":"Mourning the \u003cspan\u003eLoss\u003c/span\u003e of the Life You Imagined","_title":"field_intro_title","short_description":"Divorce is a top cause of grief, which is a natural response to loss. Whether or not you want the divorce, grieving your loss is a common and often necessary part of the healing process. As you move through grief, you may experience unexpected and intense emotions, like denial, guilt, anger, and profound sadness or depression.\r\n\r\nIt is important to acknowledge your feelings about the loss of things you once had. You might grieve the loss of companionship and shared experiences, your plan for the future, and your identity as a married person or family unit led by a married couple. It is equally important to recognize that this will not last forever. As you move through the stages of divorce, you will find resilience and a path to your new future, hopefully one that better serves you.","_short_description":"field_intro_short_description","overlay_layout":"1","_overlay_layout":"field_intro_overlay_layout","flip_layout":"0","_flip_layout":"field_intro_flip_layout"},"align":"","mode":"preview"} /-->

title: Guilt
creator: sorcram@gmail.com
content:
<!-- wp:acf/hero-component-secondary {"name":"acf/hero-component-secondary","data":{"title":"Understanding Guilt in Divorce","_title":"field_hero_component_secondary_title","title_heading_tag":"h1","_title_heading_tag":"field_hero_component_secondary_title_heading_tag","subtitle":"\u003cspan\u003eCarrying\u003c/span\u003e the Weight of a\u003cbr\u003e Failed Marriage","_subtitle":"field_hero_component_secondary_subtitle","sub_title_heading_tag":"h2","_sub_title_heading_tag":"field_hero_component_secondary_sub_title_heading_tag","short_description":"","_short_description":"field_hero_component_secondary_short_description","short_descritpion_font_bold":"0","_short_descritpion_font_bold":"field_hero_component_secondary_short_descritpion_font_bold","hero_image":313156,"_hero_image":"field_hero_component_secondary_hero_image","hero_image_mobile":89424,"_hero_image_mobile":"field_hero_component_secondary_hero_image_mobile","select_option":"cta_option","_select_option":"field_hero_component_secondary_select_option","buttons":"","_buttons":"field_hero_component_secondary_buttons","menu":"","_menu":"field_hero_component_secondary_menu","content_wrapper":"small","_content_wrapper":"field_hero_component_secondary_content_wrapper","layout_options":"full-layout","_layout_options":"field_hero_component_secondary_layout_options","column_image_cover":"0","_column_image_cover":"field_hero_component_secondary_column_image_cover","content_style":"box-view","_content_style":"field_hero_component_secondary_content_style","content_alignment":"content-middle","_content_alignment":"field_hero_component_secondary_content_alignment","inner_box_content_alignment":"justify-start","_inner_box_content_alignment":"field_hero_component_secondary_inner_box_content_alignment"},"align":"","mode":"preview"} /-->

<!-- wp:acf/intro {"name":"acf/intro","data":{"title":"Learning to Let Go and \u003cspan\u003eForgive\u003c/span\u003e Yourself","_title":"field_intro_title","short_description":"Guilt is a common and complex emotion in divorce that stems from feeling responsible for the breakdown of your marriage. You may struggle with regret over past actions, decisions, or perceived failures, leading to a deep sense of self-blame. You may carry guilt that you did not move forward with divorce sooner or for things that were beyond your control. Whether you initiated the divorce or not, guilt can manifest in various ways, including a desire to overcompensate financially, an excessive need to please the other party, or difficulty moving forward. Addressing guilt through self-compassion and, if needed, professional support is essential for navigating the emotional challenges of divorce and finding closure.","_short_description":"field_intro_short_description","overlay_layout":"1","_overlay_layout":"field_intro_overlay_layout","flip_layout":"0","_flip_layout":"field_intro_flip_layout","section_background_color":"bg-white","_section_background_color":"field_intro_section_background_color","background_color":"bg-white","_background_color":"field_intro_background_color","section_id":"intro-text","_section_id":"field_intro_section_id"},"align":"","mode":"preview"} /-->

title: Anger
creator: sorcram@gmail.com
content:
<!-- wp:acf/hero-component-secondary {"name":"acf/hero-component-secondary","data":{"title":"Understanding Anger in Divorce","_title":"field_hero_component_secondary_title","subtitle":"\u003cspan\u003eLashing Out\u003c/span\u003e Amidst Loss","_subtitle":"field_hero_component_secondary_subtitle","short_description":"","_short_description":"field_hero_component_secondary_short_description","short_descritpion_font_bold":"0","_short_descritpion_font_bold":"field_hero_component_secondary_short_descritpion_font_bold","hero_image":13411,"_hero_image":"field_hero_component_secondary_hero_image","hero_image_mobile":89425,"_hero_image_mobile":"field_hero_component_secondary_hero_image_mobile","select_option":"cta_option","_select_option":"field_hero_component_secondary_select_option","buttons":"","_buttons":"field_hero_component_secondary_buttons","menu":"","_menu":"field_hero_component_secondary_menu","content_wrapper":"small","_content_wrapper":"field_hero_component_secondary_content_wrapper","layout_options":"full-layout","_layout_options":"field_hero_component_secondary_layout_options","content_style":"box-view","_content_style":"field_hero_component_secondary_content_style","content_alignment":"content-middle","_content_alignment":"field_hero_component_secondary_content_alignment","inner_box_content_alignment":"justify-start","_inner_box_content_alignment":"field_hero_component_secondary_inner_box_content_alignment"},"align":"","mode":"preview"} /-->

<!-- wp:acf/intro {"name":"acf/intro","data":{"title":"Catalyst for \u003cspan\u003eAction\u003c/span\u003e","_title":"field_intro_title","short_description":"Anger is a natural and intense part of grieving your marriage. It is often a central reason for filing for divorce and can motivate you to take action. When left unchecked, it can also spiral out of control and threaten the safety and stability of your family. Anger is fueled by feelings of loss, betrayal, and frustration, and can come and go throughout the process. It can show up as heated arguments, resentment, and passive-aggressive behaviors. It can cloud judgment, making it difficult to engage in productive communication or reach agreements. Managing anger through healthy coping mechanisms, including therapy or mediation, can be key to finding a fair resolution so that you can move forward.","_short_description":"field_intro_short_description","overlay_layout":"1","_overlay_layout":"field_intro_overlay_layout","flip_layout":"0","_flip_layout":"field_intro_flip_layout","section_background_color":"bg-white","_section_background_color":"field_intro_section_background_color","background_color":"bg-white","_background_color":"field_intro_background_color","section_id":"intro-text","_section_id":"field_intro_section_id"},"align":"","mode":"preview"} /-->

title: Fear
creator: sorcram@gmail.com
content:
<!-- wp:acf/hero-component-secondary {"name":"acf/hero-component-secondary","data":{"title":"Understanding Fear in Divorce","_title":"field_hero_component_secondary_title","subtitle":"Facing the \u003cspan\u003eUnknown\u003c/span\u003e","_subtitle":"field_hero_component_secondary_subtitle","short_description":"","_short_description":"field_hero_component_secondary_short_description","short_descritpion_font_bold":"0","_short_descritpion_font_bold":"field_hero_component_secondary_short_descritpion_font_bold","hero_image":13406,"_hero_image":"field_hero_component_secondary_hero_image","hero_image_mobile":89426,"_hero_image_mobile":"field_hero_component_secondary_hero_image_mobile","select_option":"cta_option","_select_option":"field_hero_component_secondary_select_option","buttons":"","_buttons":"field_hero_component_secondary_buttons","menu":"","_menu":"field_hero_component_secondary_menu","content_wrapper":"small","_content_wrapper":"field_hero_component_secondary_content_wrapper","layout_options":"full-layout","_layout_options":"field_hero_component_secondary_layout_options","content_style":"box-view","_content_style":"field_hero_component_secondary_content_style","content_alignment":"content-middle","_content_alignment":"field_hero_component_secondary_content_alignment","inner_box_content_alignment":"justify-start","_inner_box_content_alignment":"field_hero_component_secondary_inner_box_content_alignment"},"align":"","mode":"preview"} /-->

<!-- wp:acf/intro {"name":"acf/intro","data":{"title":"Overcoming the Fear of \u003cspan\u003eChange\u003c/span\u003e","_title":"field_intro_title","short_description":"Fear is a common and powerful emotion in divorce that is driven by uncertainty about the future and the potential loss of stability. It can be so overwhelming that it makes it difficult to make decisions about moving forward. You may fear financial insecurity, losing custody of your children, the reaction that your partner or family might have, or the emotional toll of taking on a new identity as a single person. Life after divorce can seem unpredictable and daunting, even if you believe that you will be better off. Addressing these fears through open communication, legal guidance, and emotional support is essential for navigating the divorce process and finding a path to a brighter future.","_short_description":"field_intro_short_description","overlay_layout":"1","_overlay_layout":"field_intro_overlay_layout","flip_layout":"0","_flip_layout":"field_intro_flip_layout","section_background_color":"bg-white","_section_background_color":"field_intro_section_background_color","background_color":"bg-white","_background_color":"field_intro_background_color","section_id":"intro-text","_section_id":"field_intro_section_id"},"align":"","mode":"preview"} /-->

title: Relief
creator: sorcram@gmail.com
content:
<!-- wp:acf/hero-component-secondary {"name":"acf/hero-component-secondary","data":{"title":"Understanding Relief in Divorce","_title":"field_hero_component_secondary_title","subtitle":"\u003cspan\u003eExhale\u003c/span\u003e \u003cbr\u003e the Past","_subtitle":"field_hero_component_secondary_subtitle","short_description":"","_short_description":"field_hero_component_secondary_short_description","short_descritpion_font_bold":"0","_short_descritpion_font_bold":"field_hero_component_secondary_short_descritpion_font_bold","hero_image":13410,"_hero_image":"field_hero_component_secondary_hero_image","hero_image_mobile":89427,"_hero_image_mobile":"field_hero_component_secondary_hero_image_mobile","select_option":"cta_option","_select_option":"field_hero_component_secondary_select_option","buttons":"","_buttons":"field_hero_component_secondary_buttons","menu":"","_menu":"field_hero_component_secondary_menu","content_wrapper":"small","_content_wrapper":"field_hero_component_secondary_content_wrapper","layout_options":"full-layout","_layout_options":"field_hero_component_secondary_layout_options","content_style":"box-view","_content_style":"field_hero_component_secondary_content_style","content_alignment":"content-middle","_content_alignment":"field_hero_component_secondary_content_alignment","inner_box_content_alignment":"justify-start","_inner_box_content_alignment":"field_hero_component_secondary_inner_box_content_alignment"},"align":"","mode":"preview"} /-->

<!-- wp:acf/intro {"name":"acf/intro","data":{"title":"Feeling the Calm of Moving \u003cspan\u003eForward\u003c/span\u003e","_title":"field_intro_title","short_description":"As you begin the process of starting over, you may find yourself feeling a sense of relief as the weight of a difficult or unfulfilling marriage lifts. Newfound freedom comes from releasing yourself of the responsibility of upholding a marriage that wasn’t working, giving yourself permission to breathe more easily, and focusing on your own well-being. You may feel relief as you explore the joy of reclaiming personal space, the excitement of new opportunities, or simply the peace that comes from no longer navigating daily conflicts. While divorce is a challenging process, the relief it brings can be a powerful step toward healing and building your new, happier future.","_short_description":"field_intro_short_description","overlay_layout":"1","_overlay_layout":"field_intro_overlay_layout","flip_layout":"0","_flip_layout":"field_intro_flip_layout","section_background_color":"bg-white","_section_background_color":"field_intro_section_background_color","background_color":"bg-white","_background_color":"field_intro_background_color","section_id":"intro-text","_section_id":"field_intro_section_id"},"align":"","mode":"preview"} /-->

title: Hope
creator: sorcram@gmail.com
content:
<!-- wp:acf/hero-component-secondary {"name":"acf/hero-component-secondary","data":{"title":"Understanding Hope in Divorce","_title":"field_hero_component_secondary_title","subtitle":"A \u003cspan\u003eBrighter\u003c/span\u003e \u003cbr\u003e Future","_subtitle":"field_hero_component_secondary_subtitle","short_description":"","_short_description":"field_hero_component_secondary_short_description","short_descritpion_font_bold":"0","_short_descritpion_font_bold":"field_hero_component_secondary_short_descritpion_font_bold","hero_image":13409,"_hero_image":"field_hero_component_secondary_hero_image","hero_image_mobile":89428,"_hero_image_mobile":"field_hero_component_secondary_hero_image_mobile","select_option":"cta_option","_select_option":"field_hero_component_secondary_select_option","buttons":"","_buttons":"field_hero_component_secondary_buttons","menu":"","_menu":"field_hero_component_secondary_menu","content_wrapper":"small","_content_wrapper":"field_hero_component_secondary_content_wrapper","layout_options":"full-layout","_layout_options":"field_hero_component_secondary_layout_options","content_style":"box-view","_content_style":"field_hero_component_secondary_content_style","content_alignment":"content-middle","_content_alignment":"field_hero_component_secondary_content_alignment","inner_box_content_alignment":"justify-start","_inner_box_content_alignment":"field_hero_component_secondary_inner_box_content_alignment"},"align":"","mode":"preview"} /-->

<!-- wp:acf/intro {"name":"acf/intro","data":{"title":"Moving Forward with \u003cspan\u003eResilience\u003c/span\u003e and Optimism","_title":"field_intro_title","short_description":"Hope is an important part of navigating divorce. The promise of a new, more fulfilling chapter ahead can be a powerful incentive to find the courage that you need to move forward with confidence. It is important to cultivate hope throughout the process by taking one day at a time, envisioning the future life that you want to create, engaging in self care, and taking action to achieve your goals. Believing that divorce can lead to a brighter, more empowered version of your future can create a strong foundation for building a life that better serves you.","_short_description":"field_intro_short_description","overlay_layout":"1","_overlay_layout":"field_intro_overlay_layout","flip_layout":"0","_flip_layout":"field_intro_flip_layout","section_background_color":"bg-white","_section_background_color":"field_intro_section_background_color","background_color":"bg-white","_background_color":"field_intro_background_color","section_id":"intro-text","_section_id":"field_intro_section_id"},"align":"","mode":"preview"} /-->
